home.title: National Gallery - Simple Mirador Example
home.content:
This is project is a simple copy of the [simple-site|https://github.com/jpadfield/simple-site] repository. It has been set up to provide a dedicated example of using the system to view [IIIF|https://iiif.io] manifests within the IIIF Image viewer [Mirador|https://projectmirador.org/].

Instructions

Full details and instructions relating to how this system works can be found in the [simple-site|https://jpadfield.github.io/simple-site/] project webpages.

Four example pages have been provided, to demonstrate the presentation of IIIF resources using this system.

Standard Example
Simple Example

Simple Text Example
Complex Example

Acknowledgement

This specific project was prepared and tested as part of:

The AHRC Funded [IIIF - TANC|https://tanc-ahrc.github.io/IIIF-TNC] project

Standard Example.title: Simple Mirador - The Standard Example
Standard Example.content:
This extension uses the [IIIF|https://iiif.io] image viewer [Mirador|https://projectmirador.org/] to produce a customised presentation of a bespoke selection of IIIF manifests[@@IIIF manifests are simply a structured list of web based images resources that can be viewed in a IIIF compliant viewer, for more details see https://iiif.io/api/presentation/2.1/#table-of-contents]. It is an example of a special page that can be added presented using the [simple-site|https://github.com/jpadfield/simple-site] project.

For more information about the simple-site project and details about how this example work please see the [simple-site webpages|https://jpadfield.github.io/simple-site/].

Summary

This example page has been created using all of the available options in the [mirador JSON file|https://jpadfield.github.io/simple-site/IIIF%20viewer.html].

The Viewer

[##]

Simple Example.title: Simple Mirador - The Simple Example
Simple Example.content:
This extension uses the [IIIF|https://iiif.io] image viewer [Mirador|https://projectmirador.org/] to produce a customised presentation of a bespoke selection of IIIF manifests[@@IIIF manifests are simply a structured list of web based images resources that can be viewed in a IIIF compliant viewer, for more details see https://iiif.io/api/presentation/2.1/#table-of-contents]. It is an example of a special page that can be added presented using the [simple-site|https://github.com/jpadfield/simple-site] project.

For more information about the simple-site project and details about how this example work please see the [simple-site webpages|https://jpadfield.github.io/simple-site/].

Summary

This simple example page has been created using only the manifest section of the [mirador JSON file|https://jpadfield.github.io/simple-site/IIIF%20viewer.html].

The Viewer

[##]

The Viewer

Further Examples.title: Simple Mirador - Further Examples
Further Examples.content: Additional Examples will be linked below this page.

The Entombment.title: Technical Study - The Entombment
The Entombment.content:
This extension uses the [IIIF|https://iiif.io] image viewer [Mirador|https://projectmirador.org/] to produce a customised presentation of a bespoke selection of IIIF manifests[@@IIIF manifests are simply a structured list of web based images resources that can be viewed in a IIIF compliant viewer, for more details see https://iiif.io/api/presentation/2.1/#table-of-contents]. It is an example of a special page that can be added presented using the [simple-site|https://github.com/jpadfield/simple-site] project.

For more information about the simple-site project and details about how this example work please see the [simple-site webpages|https://jpadfield.github.io/simple-site/].

Summary

This example presents a series of images take of [The Entombment|https://artuk.org/discover/artworks/the-entombment-138881] by [Rembrandt van Rijn (1606â€“1669)|https://artuk.org/discover/artists/rembrandt-van-rijn-16061669], [Hunterian Art Gallery, University of Glasgow|https://artuk.org/visit/venues/hunterian-art-gallery-university-of-glasgow-5924]. These images where taken at the [The National Gallery|https://www.nationalgallery.org.uk/] as part of a detailed technical examination. As the painting is relatively small is was possible to take some very high resolution images, with the overall visible image captured at about 1500 ppi and the two visible detail images captured at about 4000 ppi.

The Viewer

[##]

The Adoration of the Kings.title: Illustrated Catalogues - The Adoration of the Kings
The Adoration of the Kings.content:
This extension uses the [IIIF|https://iiif.io] image viewer [Mirador|https://projectmirador.org/] to produce a customised presentation of a bespoke selection of IIIF manifests[@@IIIF manifests are simply a structured list of web based images resources that can be viewed in a IIIF compliant viewer, for more details see https://iiif.io/api/presentation/2.1/#table-of-contents]. It is an example of a special page that can be added presented using the [simple-site|https://github.com/jpadfield/simple-site] project.

For more information about the simple-site project and details about how this example work please see the [simple-site webpages|https://jpadfield.github.io/simple-site/].

Summary

To coincide with the [Jan Gossaert's Renaissance|https://www.nationalgallery.org.uk/whats-on/exhibitions/jan-gossaerts-renaissance] exhibition (2011), the full catalogue entry of Gossaert's [The Adoration of the Kings|https://www.nationalgallery.org.uk/paintings/jan-gossaert-jean-gossart-the-adoration-of-the-kings], taken from 'The Sixteenth Century Netherlandish Paintings with French Paintings before 1600' by Lorne Campbell, was published on the Gallery website in advance of book publication. Find out more about the [catalogues|https://www.nationalgallery.org.uk/paintings/research/the-national-gallery-catalogues].
Lorne Campbell was George Beaumont Senior Research Curator at the National Gallery. He is the author of numerous publications including â€˜The Fifteenth Century Netherlandish Paintingsâ€™ in the new series of National Gallery Catalogues.

The Viewer

[##]
